nvt_name: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information via HTTP
description:
The following input fields were identified (URL:input name):

http://10.0.96.33/drupal/:pass
http://10.0.96.33/drupal/?D=A:pass
http://10.0.96.33/payroll_app.php:password
http://10.0.96.33/phpmyadmin/:pma_password
http://10.0.96.33/phpmyadmin/?D=A:pma_password
http://10.0.96.33/phpmyadmin/changelog.php:pma_password
http://10.0.96.33/phpmyadmin/index.php:pma_password
http://10.0.96.33/phpmyadmin/license.php:pma_password
http://10.0.96.33/phpmyadmin/url.php:pma_password
solution:
Enforce the transmission of sensitive data via an encrypted SSL/TLS connection.
  Additionally make sure the host / application is redirecting all users to the secured SSL/TLS connection before
  allowing to input sensitive data into the mentioned functions.

nvt_name: Drupal 7.0 Information Disclosure Vulnerability - Active Check
solution:
No known solution was made available for at least one year
  since the disclosure of this vulnerability. Likely none will be provided anymore. General solution
  options are to upgrade to a newer release, disable respective features, remove the product or
  replace the product by another one.

nvt_name: Drupal Coder RCE Vulnerability (SA-CONTRIB-2016-039) - Active Check
Drupal Core SQLi Vulnerability (SA-CORE-2014-005) - Active Check
solution:
Updates are available. Please see the references for more
  information.
